labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed for performance analysis and optimization of Go applications. It focuses on analyzing Go pprof performance profiles to identify bottlenecks, visualize CPU and memory usage through flame graphs, and generate detailed reports. The available tools enable the generation of flame graphs (SVG format) and the analysis of pprof files, making it a specialized tool for developers working with Go applications to improve their performance.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality revolves around performance profiling and optimization, which aligns closely with development tools. The secondary labels are added because the tools are specific to Go applications and involve data visualization for performance analysis. No custom label is needed as the predefined labels effectively cover the server's functionality.

server_info_crawled.name: PPROF Analyzer
server_info_crawled.author: @ZephyrDeng/pprof-analyzer-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Analyze Go pprof performance profiles to identify bottlenecks and optimize your applications. Generate flame graphs and detailed reports to visualize CPU and memory usage effectively. Enhance your performance tuning with easy-to-use tools for profiling and analysis.

tools.name: analyze_pprof
tools.description: Deploy Server PPROF Analyzer @ZephyrDeng/pprof-analyzer-mcp Try in Playground analyze_pprof

tools.description: 使用 'go tool pprof' 生成指定 pprof 文件的火焰图 (SVG 格式)。

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@ZephyrDeng/pprof-analyzer-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
